nodes.text: Imperial Justice: Triumph of the New Order

"Imperial Justice: Triumph of the New Order" was an exhibit held at the Imperial Heritage Museum during the reign of the Galactic Empire as well as during the New Republic era. The exhibit examined the case of Vune Willic, an Imperial Intelligence agent who was found guilty of attempting to assassinate Emperor Palpatine.

Multiple exhibits were featured in "Imperial Justice: Triumph of the New Order" to showcase how the Imperial Intelligence agent Vune Willic came to be executed by the Galactic Empire for the crime of attemting to assassinate Emperor Palpatine. A message from Willic to his parents that wrote of the his arrival to Imperial Center, the Empire's capital planet, was shown in the exhibit. The message was written as Willic was transported a few levels from a landing pad in the planet's Senate district to his grandfather home near the Uscru Entertainment District.

Another exhibit was an entry in Willic's triple-encrypted personal holographic journal that detailed his meeting with Ysanne Isard, Security Director of Imperial Intelligence's Internal Security Branch.

"Imperial Justice: Triumph of the New Order" was a feature of the Imperial Heritage Museum, an institution dedicated to preserving the Empire's documents and relics which was located in Galactic City on Coruscant, the capital of the Empire and later the New Republic.

"Imperial Justice: Triumph of the New Order" was mentioned throughout "Coruscant: Center of the Empire," an article series of the Planet Hoppers online supplement for Wizards of the Coast's Star Wars Roleplaying Game. Written by Cory J. Herndon, the article series was published on Wizards.com from April 3 to April 24 in 2003.
